text: thousands of people are demonstrating
against the abduction of 43 trainee
teachers they're being led by relatives
of the missing victims the students were
taken in the southern state of guerrero
by police linked to drug gangs Mexico's
Attorney General has said there is
strong evidence all of them are dead the
bbc's were a davis is there for us
corruption and political violence are
endemic in Mexico in the last decade a
hundred thousand people have died 27,000
people have been missing yet this single
incident the disappearance of 43
students in a southern state of guerrero
has galvanized all of this opposition
here in the center of Mexico City this
is a huge March starting from the Antel
and it will go down all the way to the
zocalo the old center of the city
everybody here is indignant they're
angry that the government of Pena Nieto
has failed to get on top of this crisis
they don't know what happened to the 43
students are they still alive
have they been killed what we do know is
that they were abducted almost certainly
on the orders of a local politician
allied to local gangs in the state of
Guerrero itself many Mexicans have
simply had enough they're used to
disappearance they used to murder but
this case these 43 people you hear the
numbers 1 2 43 being shouted out across
the city tonight Mexicans have had
enough and they want their government to
find out what happened to the missing
students
